items.name: UCPDR
items.description: USB Type-C™ and Power Delivery register

fields.name: APC
fields.description: Apply pull-up and pull-down configuration When this bit is set, the I/O pull-up and pull-down configurations defined in PUCRx and PDCRx are applied. When this bit is cleared, PUCRx and PDCRx are not applied to the I/Os.

fields.name: BREN
fields.description: Backup RAM retention in Standby and VBAT modes When this bit is set, the backup RAM content is kept in Standby and VBAT modes. If BREN is reset, the backup RAM can still be used in Run, Sleep and Stop modes. However, its content is lost in Standby, Shutdown and VBAT modes. This bit can be written only when the regulator is LDO, which must be configured before switching to SMPS. Note: Backup RAM cannot be preserved in Shutdown mode.

fields.name: MONEN
fields.description: Backup domain voltage and temperature monitoring enable

fields.name: VBE
fields.description: VBAT charging enable

fields.name: VBRS
fields.description: VBAT charging resistor selection

fields.name: VBATH
fields.description: Backup domain voltage level monitoring versus high threshold

fields.name: TEMPL
fields.description: Temperature level monitoring versus low threshold

fields.name: TEMPH
fields.description: Temperature level monitoring versus high threshold

fields.name: LPMS
fields.description: Low-power mode selection These bits select the low-power mode entered when the CPU enters the Deepsleep mode. 10x: Standby mode (Standby mode also entered if LPMS=11X in CR1 with BREN=1 in BDCR1) 11x: Shutdown mode if BREN = 0 in BDCR1

fields.name: RRSB1
fields.description: SRAM2 page 1 retention in Stop 3 and Standby modes This bit is used to keep the SRAM2 page 1 content in Stop 3 and Standby modes. The SRAM2 page 1 corresponds to the first 8 Kbytes of the SRAM2 (from SRAM2 base address to SRAM2 base address + 0x1FFF). Note: This bit has no effect in Shutdown mode.

fields.name: RRSB2
fields.description: SRAM2 page 2 retention in Stop 3 and Standby modes This bit is used to keep the SRAM2 page 2 content in Stop 3 and Standby modes. The SRAM2 page 2 corresponds to the last 56 Kbytes of the SRAM2 (from SRAM2 base address + 0x2000 to SRAM2 base address + 0xFFFF). Note: This bit has no effect in Shutdown mode.

fields.name: ULPMEN
fields.description: BOR ultra-low power mode This bit is used to reduce the consumption by configuring the BOR in discontinuous mode. This bit must be set to reach the lowest power consumption in the low-power modes.

fields.name: SRAM1PD
fields.description: SRAM1 power down This bit is used to reduce the consumption by powering off the SRAM1.

fields.name: SRAM2PD
fields.description: SRAM2 power down This bit is used to reduce the consumption by powering off the SRAM2.

fields.name: SRAM3PD
fields.description: SRAM3 power down This bit is used to reduce the consumption by powering off the SRAM3.

fields.name: SRAM4PD
fields.description: SRAM4 power down This bit is used to reduce the consumption by powering off the SRAM4.

fields.name: SRAM1PDS1
fields.description: SRAM1 page 1 (64 Kbytes) power-down in Stop modes (Stop 0, 1, 2, 3)

fields.name: SRAM1PDS2
fields.description: SRAM1 page 2 (64 Kbytes) power-down in Stop modes (Stop 0, 1, 2, 3)

fields.name: SRAM1PDS3
fields.description: SRAM1 page 3 (64 Kbytes) power-down in Stop modes (Stop 0, 1, 2, 3)

fields.name: SRAM2PDS1
fields.description: SRAM2 page 1 (8 Kbytes) power-down in Stop modes (Stop 0, 1, 2) Note: The SRAM2 page 1 retention in Stop 3 is controlled by RRSB1 bit in CR1.

fields.name: SRAM2PDS2
fields.description: SRAM2 page 2 (56 Kbytes) power-down in Stop modes (Stop 0, 1, 2) Note: The SRAM2 page 2 retention in Stop 3 is controlled by RRSB2 bit in CR1.

fields.name: SRAM4PDS
fields.description: SRAM4 power-down in Stop modes (Stop 0, 1, 2, 3)

fields.name: ICRAMPDS
fields.description: ICACHE SRAM power-down in Stop modes (Stop 0, 1, 2, 3)

fields.name: DC1RAMPDS
fields.description: DCACHE1 SRAM power-down in Stop modes (Stop 0, 1, 2, 3)

fields.name: DMA2DRAMPDS
fields.description: DMA2D SRAM power-down in Stop modes (Stop 0, 1, 2, 3)

fields.name: PRAMPDS
fields.description: FMAC, FDCAN and USB peripherals SRAM power-down in Stop modes (Stop0,1,2,3)

fields.name: PKARAMPDS
fields.description: PKA SRAM power-down

fields.name: SRAM4FWU
fields.description: SRAM4 fast wakeup from Stop 0, Stop 1 and Stop 2 modes This bit is used to obtain the best trade-off between low-power consumption and wakeup time. SRAM4 wakeup time increases the wakeup time when exiting Stop 0, 1 and 2 modes, and also increases the LPDMA access time to SRAM4 during Stop modes.

fields.name: FLASHFWU
fields.description: Flash memory fast wakeup from Stop 0 and Stop 1 modes This bit is used to obtain the best trade-off between low-power consumption and wakeup time when exiting the Stop 0 or Stop 1 modes. When this bit is set, the Flash memory remains in normal mode in Stop 0 and Stop 1 modes, which offers a faster startup time with higher consumption.

fields.name: SRAM3PDS1
fields.description: SRAM3 page 1 (64 Kbytes) power-down in Stop modes (Stop 0, 1, 2, 3)

fields.name: SRAM3PDS2
fields.description: SRAM3 page 2 (64 Kbytes) power-down in Stop modes (Stop 0, 1, 2, 3)

fields.name: SRAM3PDS3
fields.description: SRAM3 page 3 (64 Kbytes) power-down in Stop modes (Stop 0, 1, 2, 3)

fields.name: SRAM3PDS4
fields.description: SRAM3 page 4 (64 Kbytes) power-down in Stop modes (Stop 0, 1, 2, 3)

fields.name: SRAM3PDS5
fields.description: SRAM3 page 5 (64 Kbytes) power-down in Stop modes (Stop 0, 1, 2, 3)

fields.name: SRAM3PDS6
fields.description: SRAM3 page 6 (64 Kbytes) power-down in Stop modes (Stop 0, 1, 2, 3)

fields.name: SRAM3PDS7
fields.description: SRAM3 page 7 (64 Kbytes) power-down in Stop modes (Stop 0, 1, 2, 3)

fields.name: SRAM3PDS8
fields.description: SRAM3 page 8 (64 Kbytes) power-down in Stop modes (Stop 0, 1, 2, 3)

fields.name: SRDRUN
fields.description: SmartRun domain in Run mode

fields.name: REGSEL
fields.description: Regulator selection Note: REGSEL is reserved and must be kept at reset value in packages without SMPS.

fields.name: FSTEN
fields.description: Fast soft start

fields.name: DBP
fields.description: Disable Backup domain write protection In reset state, all registers and SRAM in Backup domain are protected against parasitic write access. This bit must be set to enable the write access to these registers.

fields.name: P
fields.description: Port pull bit y (y=0..15)

fields.name: SPRIV
fields.description: secure functions privilege configuration This bit is set and reset by software. It can be written only by a secure privileged access.

fields.name: NSPRIV
fields.description: non-secure functions privilege configuration This bit is set and reset by software. It can be written only by privileged access, secure or non-secure.

fields.name: WUP1SEC
fields.description: WUP1 secure protection

fields.name: LPMSEC
fields.description: Low-power modes secure protection

fields.name: VDMSEC
fields.description: Voltage detection and monitoring secure protection

fields.name: VBSEC
fields.description: Backup domain secure protection

fields.name: APCSEC
fields.description: Pull-up/pull-down secure protection

fields.name: CSSF
fields.description: Clear Stop and Standby flags This bit is protected against non-secure access when LPMSEC=1 in SECCFGR. This bit is protected against unprivileged access when LPMSEC=1 and SPRIV=1 in PRIVCFGR, or when LPMSEC=0 and NSPRIV=1. Writing 1 to this bit clears the STOPF and SBF flags.

fields.name: STOPF
fields.description: Stop flag This bit is set by hardware when the device enters a Stop mode, and is cleared by software by writing 1 to the CSSF bit.

fields.name: SBF
fields.description: Standby flag This bit is set by hardware when the device enters the Standby mode, and is cleared by writing 1 to the CSSF bit, or by a power-on reset. It is not cleared by the system reset.

fields.name: PVDE
fields.description: Power voltage detector enable

fields.name: PVDLS
fields.description: Power voltage detector level selection These bits select the voltage threshold detected by the power voltage detector:

fields.name: UVMEN
fields.description: VDDUSB independent USB voltage monitor enable

fields.name: IO2VMEN
fields.description: VDDIO2 independent I/Os voltage monitor enable

fields.name: AVM1EN
fields.description: VDDA independent analog supply voltage monitor 1 enable (1.6V threshold)

fields.name: AVM2EN
fields.description: VDDA independent analog supply voltage monitor 2 enable (1.8V threshold)

fields.name: USV
fields.description: VDDUSB independent USB supply valid

fields.name: IO2SV
fields.description: VDDIO2 independent I/Os supply valid This bit is used to validate the VDDIO2 supply for electrical and logical isolation purpose. Setting this bit is mandatory to use PG[15:2]. If VDDIO2 is not always present in the application, the VDDIO2 voltage monitor can be used to determine whether this supply is ready or not.

fields.name: ASV
fields.description: VDDA independent analog supply valid

fields.name: REGS
fields.description: Regulator selection

fields.name: PVDO
fields.description: VDD voltage detector output

fields.name: ACTVOSRDY
fields.description: Voltage level ready for currently used VOS

fields.name: ACTVOS
fields.description: VOS currently applied to VCORE This field provides the last VOS value.

fields.name: VDDUSBRDY
fields.description: VDDUSB ready

fields.name: VDDIO2RDY
fields.description: VDDIO2 ready

fields.name: VDDA1RDY
fields.description: VDDA ready versus 1.6V voltage monitor

fields.name: VDDA2RDY
fields.description: VDDA ready versus 1.8V voltage monitor

fieldset/UCPDR.description: USB Type-C™ and Power Delivery register

fields.name: UCPD_DBDIS
fields.description: UCPD dead battery disable After exiting reset, the USB Type-C “dead battery” behavior is enabled, which may have a pull-down effect on CC1 and CC2 pins. It is recommended to disable it in all cases, either to stop this pull-down or to handover control to the UCPD (the UCPD must be initialized before doing the disable).

fields.name: UCPD_STBY
fields.description: UCPD Standby mode When set, this bit is used to memorize the UCPD configuration in Standby mode. This bit must be written to 1 just before entering Standby mode when using UCPD. It must be written to 0 after exiting the Standby mode and before writing any UCPD registers.

fields.name: BOOSTRDY
fields.description: EPOD booster ready This bit is set to 1 by hardware when the power booster startup time is reached. The system clock frequency can be switched higher than 50 MHz only after this bit is set.

fields.name: VOSRDY
fields.description: Ready bit for VCORE voltage scaling output selection

fields.name: VOS
fields.description: Voltage scaling range selection This field is protected against non-secure access when SYSCLKSEC=1 in RCC_SECCFGR. It is protected against unprivileged access when SYSCLKSEC=1 in RCC_SECCFGR and SPRIV=1 in PRIVCFGR, or when SYSCLKSEC=0 and NSPRIV=1.

fields.name: BOOSTEN
fields.description: EPOD booster enable

fields.name: WUPEN
fields.description: Wakeup pin WKUP1 enable

fields.name: WUPP
fields.description: Wakeup pin WKUP1 polarity. This bit must be configured when WUPEN1 = 0.

fields.name: WUSEL1
fields.description: Wakeup pin WKUP1 selection This field must be configured when WUPEN1 = 0.

fields.name: WUSEL2
fields.description: Wakeup pin WKUP2 selection This field must be configured when WUPEN2 = 0.

fields.name: WUSEL3
fields.description: Wakeup pin WKUP3 selection This field must be configured when WUPEN3 = 0.

fields.name: WUSEL4
fields.description: Wakeup pin WKUP4 selection This field must be configured when WUPEN4 = 0.

fields.name: WUSEL5
fields.description: Wakeup pin WKUP5 selection This field must be configured when WUPEN5 = 0.

fields.name: WUSEL6
fields.description: Wakeup pin WKUP6 selection This field must be configured when WUPEN6 = 0.

fields.name: WUSEL7
fields.description: Wakeup pin WKUP7 selection This field must be configured when WUPEN7 = 0.

fields.name: WUSEL8
fields.description: Wakeup pin WKUP8 selection This field must be configured when WUPEN8 = 0.

fields.name: CWUF1
fields.description: Wakeup flag 1 Writing 1 to this bit clears the WUF1 flag in WUSR.

fields.name: CWUF2
fields.description: Wakeup flag 2 Writing 1 to this bit clears the WUF2 flag in WUSR.

fields.name: CWUF3
fields.description: Wakeup flag 3 Writing 1 to this bit clears the WUF3 flag in WUSR.

fields.name: CWUF4
fields.description: Wakeup flag 4 Writing 1 to this bit clears the WUF4 flag in WUSR.

fields.name: CWUF5
fields.description: Wakeup flag 5 Writing 1 to this bit clears the WUF5 flag in WUSR.

fields.name: CWUF6
fields.description: Wakeup flag 6 Writing 1 to this bit clears the WUF6 flag in WUSR.

fields.name: CWUF7
fields.description: Wakeup flag 7 Writing 1 to this bit clears the WUF7 flag in WUSR.

fields.name: CWUF8
fields.description: Wakeup flag 8 Writing 1 to this bit clears the WUF8 flag in WUSR.

fields.name: WUF1
fields.description: Wakeup flag 1 This bit is set when a wakeup event is detected on WKUP1 pin. This bit is cleared by writing 1 in the CWUF1 bit of WUSCR when WUSEL ≠ 11, or by hardware when WUPEN1=0.

fields.name: WUF2
fields.description: Wakeup flag 2 This bit is set when a wakeup event is detected on WKUP2 pin. This bit is cleared by writing 1 in the CWUF2 bit of WUSCR when WUSEL ≠ 11, or by hardware when WUPEN2=0.

fields.name: WUF3
fields.description: Wakeup flag 3 This bit is set when a wakeup event is detected on WKUP3 pin. This bit is cleared by writing 1 in the CWUF3 bit of WUSCR when WUSEL ≠ 11, or by hardware when WUPEN3=0.

fields.name: WUF4
fields.description: Wakeup flag 4 This bit is set when a wakeup event is detected on WKUP4 pin. This bit is cleared by writing 1 in the CWUF4 bit of WUSCR when WUSEL ≠ 11, or by hardware when WUPEN4=0.

fields.name: WUF5
fields.description: Wakeup flag 5 This bit is set when a wakeup event is detected on WKUP5 pin. This bit is cleared by writing 1 in the CWUF5 bit of WUSCR when WUSEL ≠ 11, or by hardware when WUPEN5=0.

fields.name: WUF6
fields.description: Wakeup flag 6 This bit is set when a wakeup event is detected on WKUP6 pin. This bit is cleared by writing 1 in the CWUF6 bit of WUSCR when WUSEL ≠ 11, or by hardware when WUPEN6=0. If WUSEL=11, this bit is cleared by hardware when all internal wakeup source are cleared.

fields.name: WUF7
fields.description: Wakeup flag 7 This bit is set when a wakeup event is detected on WKUP7 pin. This bit is cleared by writing 1 in the CWUF7 bit of WUSCR when WUSEL ≠ 11, or by hardware when WUPEN7=0. If WUSEL=11, this bit is cleared by hardware when all internal wakeup source are cleared.

fields.name: WUF8
fields.description: Wakeup flag 8 This bit is set when a wakeup event is detected on WKUP8 pin. This bit is cleared by writing 1 in the CWUF8 bit of WUSCR when WUSEL ≠ 11, or by hardware when WUPEN8=0. If WUSEL=11, this bit is cleared by hardware when all internal wakeup source are cleared.

variants.name: LowPower
variants.description: Flash memory enters low-power mode in Stop 0 and Stop 1 modes (lower-power consumption).

variants.name: Normal
variants.description: Flash memory remains in normal mode in Stop 0 and Stop 1 modes (faster wakeup time).

variants.name: pvd_in
variants.description: External input analog voltage PVD_IN (compared internally to VREFINT)

variants.name: AboveOrEqual
variants.description: VDD is equal or above the PVD threshold selected by PVDLS[2:0].

variants.name: Below
variants.description: VDD is below the PVD threshold selected by PVDLS[2:0].

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: SRAM4 enters low-power mode in Stop 0, 1 and 2 modes (source biasing for lower-power consumption).

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: SRAM4 remains in normal mode in Stop 0, 1 and 2 modes (higher consumption but no SRAM4 wakeup time).

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: Backup domain voltage level < high threshold

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: Backup domain voltage level ≥ high threshold

variants.name: B_0x0
variants.description: Charge VBAT through a 5 kΩ resistor

variants.name: B_0x1
variants.description: Charge VBAT through a 1.5 kΩ resistor

variants.name: Range1
variants.description: Range 1 (highest frequency). This value cannot be written when VCOREMEN = 1 in TAMP_OR register.
